text: Was there a resolution to this? I am trying to prepopulate a field `onFormReady.`

Hi can anyone help me? I am trying to prepopulate a hidden field in a pop up CTA. The below code works fine for a form directly on the page but doesn't seem to work for a form on a pop-up CTA.
`<script>`
  `window.addEventListener('message', event => {`
   `if(event.data.type === 'hsFormCallback' && event.data.eventName === 'onFormReady') {`
       `$('input[name="form_submitter_object_id"]').val("{{contact.hs_object_id}}")`
   `}`
`});`
`</script>`
is there a tutorial that shows how to create a dynamic page using hubdb?

Hi, I’ve got a Nuxt website (ie Vue JS single page application with server-sided rendering) with the HubSpot tracking JS installed and I’m having issues with pop-up forms and CTAs not appearing on in-app page navigation. The forms load correctly when first visiting the page in a new tab or with a page refresh but don’t appear after the Vue router has redirected to the page. The page tracking is working as intended after following the instructions (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code#tracking-in-single-page-applications>) however the forms and CTAs don’t appear and I’m thinking its because the tracking and form/CTA libraries work independently. Has anyone else experienced similar issues and (hopefully) found a solution to getting HubSpot JS working on SPAs :slightly_smiling_face: ? Thanks!
